cellularAutomata.util
Class MemoryManagementTools

  cellularAutomata.util.MemoryManagementTools

public class MemoryManagementTools
extends java.lang.Object

A collection of handy methods for memory management.

Author:
David Bahr

Method Detail

convertBytesToGigaBytes

public static double convertBytesToGigaBytes(long bytes)
Converts bytes into the equivalent number of gigabytes.

Parameters:
bytes - The number of bytes that will be converted.
Returns:
The equivalent number of gigabytes (as a fraction).

convertBytesToMegaBytes

public static double convertBytesToMegaBytes(long bytes)
Converts bytes into the equivalent number of megabytes.

Parameters:
bytes - The number of bytes that will be converted.
Returns:
The equivalent number of megabytes (as a fraction).

getMaximumMemoryAvailableToApplication

public static long getMaximumMemoryAvailableToApplication()
The size of the Java object heap. In other words, this gives the maximum amount of memory that has been made available to the JVM. See http://java.sun.com/docs/books/performance/1st_edition/html/JPRAMFootprint.fm.html for an explanation.

Returns:
The maximum memory available to the application in bytes.

getMemoryCurrentlyInUse

public static long getMemoryCurrentlyInUse()
The amount of memory currently in use by the JVM. Calculated by taking the difference between the total memory allocated (totalMemory()) minus the unused memory from within that allocation (freeMemory()).

Returns:
The memory currently in use in bytes.

getMemoryAvailable

public static long getMemoryAvailable()
Estimates the memory still available to the JVM. Estimated by taking the difference between the maximum memory available to the JVM (maxMemory()) minus the total memory already allocated (totalMemory()). To this, we add any memory still available from that which was allocated (freeMemory()).

Returns:
An estimate of the available memory in bytes .

getPercentMemoryUsed

public static double getPercentMemoryUsed()
Estimates the percentage of memory in use. Estimated by dividing the memory currently in use by the maximum total memory that can be made available.

Returns:
A number between 0.0 and 1.0.
